When set up correctly this option allows: When set up correctly this option allows participants to choose what country they want to see images from and records contributions by country.
You can select multiple categories of t: You can select multiple categories of the correct type.
Depth must be set to 0 for all categorie: La profondeur est fixée à 0 pour toutes les catégories d’une campagne Wiki Loves.
Requires categories of the form images f: Les catégories utilisées dans le cadre d’un projet Wiki Loves doivent se présenter sous la forme “images from Wiki Loves X YYYY” (par exemple, “Images from Wiki Loves Africa 2019”)

If you want a category and ALL of its su: Utiliser la profondeur pour indiquer le nombre de sous-catégories que vous voulez sélectionner. Le niveau le plus profond et contenant le plus d’images est 5. Rappel: les campagnes Wiki Loves sont obligatoirement à un niveau de profondeur de 0

The maximum height for the campaign imag: La hauteur maximum du visuel de la campagne est de 150 px. Il peut s’agir d’un logo ou d’une image.
Portrait or square photos are not recomm: Les photos en mode portrait ou carrées sont déconseillées.
Enter the FILE NAME only of a image from: Seules des images issues de Commons peuvent être utilisées. Indiquez seulement le nom du fichier.

Easily add information about images on W: Easily add information about images on Wikimedia Commons
<strong>ISA</strong> is a fun, multiling: ISA is a fun, multilingual, mobile-first tool, that makes it easy for people to add "micro contributions" in the form of structured data to images on Wikimedia Commons that have been added by Wiki Loves competitions.
ISA is originally built to provide bette: ISA is originally built to provide better multilingual and structured descriptions of Wiki Loves Africa images.
But it is also developed to be useful to: But it is also developed to be useful to all of the Wiki Loves competitions and, ultimately, for all media files on Wikimedia Commons.
<strong>Wikimedia Commons</strong> (also: Wikimedia Commons (also known as 'Commons') is a Wikimedia project, a sister project of Wikipedia, and a collection of more than 40 million free media files.
All the freely licensed photos, audio an: All the freely licensed photos, audio and video files, PDFs and other media on Wikipedia are stored on Commons.
Wikimedia Commons grows rapidly, by appr: Wikimedia Commons grows rapidly, by approximately 5 million new media files per year.
Thousands of volunteers upload files to: Thousands of volunteers upload files to Commons, and integrate these into Wikimedia projects, like Wikipedia, to illustrate the content there and to share that media with the public.
Media files on Commons are typically:: Media files on Commons are typically:
Personal photography and media uploaded: Personal photography and media uploaded by individuals, sometimes during Wiki Loves competitions such as Wiki Loves Africa, Wiki Loves Monuments, Wiki Loves Earth etc;
Freely licensed media files from externa: Freely licensed media files from external websites like Flickr, YouTube, open access journals, and other repositories; and
Donations from institutions and organiza: Donations from institutions and organizations with substantial media collections, large and small, ranging from UNESCO, NASA and the British Library to small local cultural institutions.
What is structured data on Commons ?: What is structured data on Commons ?
<strong>Structured Data on Commons</stro: Structured Data on Commons is a project that provides the technical infrastructure to complement the wikitext, templates and categories on Wikimedia Commons with structured data.
Structured data is data with a high degr: Structured data is data with a high degree of structured organization.
With more structure, it becomes easier t: With more structure, it becomes easier to reuse data in other Wikimedia projects and by third parties; it also allows computers to process and 'understand' it.
Structured Data is an ongoing project th: Structured Data is an ongoing project that was launched in 2019 ! … whilst Wikimedia Commons has been around for years !
There are literally millions of pictures: There are literally millions of pictures hosted on Wikimedia Commons… that need attention and love.
Millions of pictures that are not descri: Millions of pictures that are not described with structured data at the moment.
How are we going to do that ?: How are we going to do that ?
<strong>Curating</strong>, or curation,: Curating, or curation, in the narrow sense, means: selecting and organizing pieces of artwork and cultural heritage for an exhibition.
This term can also be used more broadly,: This term can also be used more broadly, to describe any activity that involves selecting, organizing and presenting information.
In the context of Structured Data on Com: In the context of Structured Data on Commons, curating means all the activities performed by Commons contributors to organize and present the media files on Wikimedia Commons: administrative actions, adding more and better metadata to the files, grouping them in categories, creating galleries...
So...how does the ISA tool fit in there: So...how does the ISA tool fit in there ?
The ISA tool allows to add two different: The ISA tool allows to add two different types of structured data to set of pictures: captions and depicts (more explanations below on what captions and depicts are).
It is a multilingual, mobile-first 'micr: It is a multilingual, mobile-first 'micro-contributions' tool, that makes it easy for people to add structured data to images contributed to Wiki Loves competitions on Wikimedia Commons.
The tool operates with curated campaigns: The tool operates with curated campaigns created by coordinators.
Anyone with a Wikimedia account may be a: Anyone with a Wikimedia account may be a coordinator!
With ISA, the coordinator can choose a p: With ISA, the coordinator can choose a predefined set of images on Commons, select a starting date and an end date for the campaign, and provide general information about the campaign itself.
The coordinator can then ask contributor: The coordinator can then ask contributors to "tag" these images with multilingual structured metadata (depicts and/or captions).
Points are counted for each contribution: Points are counted for each contribution made by a participant, and therefore it is possible to organize "tagging" or micro-contributions competitions or challenges with ISA.
Anyone with a Wikimedia account can cont: Anyone with a Wikimedia account can contribute to add structured metadata to a campaign.
The only requirement is… to be logged-in: The only requirement is… to be logged-in.
Learn more about file captions and depic: Learn more about file captions and depicts
File captions are a feature part of Stru: File captions are a feature part of Structured data.
They are meant to store short, multiling: They are meant to store short, multilingual description about files.
What is a good caption ? and what is the: What is a good caption ? and what is the difference between our good old file descriptions and captions ?
First, captions are meant to be simple a: First, captions are meant to be simple and short.
While descriptions can be very expansive: While descriptions can be very expansive, captions are limited to 255 characters in length, and cannot contain markup (like Wikitext links or HTML) and do not support external links.
In many cases, the caption will be simil: In many cases, the caption will be similar or identical to the description.
But in other cases, there is a very exte: But in other cases, there is a very extensive description (858 characters, and links) and the caption is much shorter (more or less the same caption used on the Wikipedia articles using that image).
Only text which is so short that it is n: Only text which is so short that it is not copyrightable should be copied into captions, as captions are published under a CC0 ("public domain") waiver.
One of the core benefits of captions is: One of the core benefits of captions is improved language-aware searchability.
Classical file descriptions are in the w: Classical file descriptions are in the wikitext, and are only searchable through full-text search, which necessarily searches through the entire page contents, including categories and license templates; and it is not possible to do search search per language.
Captions are available as part of our st: Captions are available as part of our structured data, while descriptions are not.
In technical terms, a description is pla: In technical terms, a description is plain wikitext wrapped in a language template, wrapped again in an Information template; while captions are Wikibase labels.
As such, captions will be searchable thr: As such, captions will be searchable through the API, making it easy to find/filter/pull captions from files as metadata.
As they are searchable via the API, it i: As they are searchable via the API, it is also easier for 3rd party reusers to find and reuse media and the captions themselves.
Other possible usages of captions can be: Other possible usages of captions can be:
query files for missing captions in a gi: query files for missing captions in a given language
building lists for translation of import: building lists for translation of important files needing a caption localized for a project or campaign
Find more information about Captions her: Find more information about Captions here
Depicts is also a feature part of Struct: Depicts is also a feature part of Structured data.
It was enabled on Wikimedia Commons on A: It was enabled on Wikimedia Commons on April 2019.
To add a depicts statement, simply start: To add a depicts statement, simply start typing in the search box to get started.
Then for each depicted item in the image: Then for each depicted item in the image, find the appropriate item from Wikidata and select it.
If you have trouble finding the right Wi: If you have trouble finding the right Wikidata item, test alternative spellings.
If there is no Wikidata item associated: If there is no Wikidata item associated with the subject depicted, choose a more generic item which includes your subject as an example.
Be as specific as you can with the prima: Be as specific as you can with the primary tag.
If there are multiple items clearly and: If there are multiple items clearly and deliberately depicted by the media file, all should be added as separate depicts statements, within reason.
For files that depict dozens or hundreds: For files that depict dozens or hundreds of items (e.g. movies) only list those items which are most prominent.
There is also an option to mark a partic: There is also an option to mark a particular item as 'prominent'.
This property refers to the item's promi: This property refers to the item's prominence in the piece of media.
More information about depicts may be fo: More information about depicts may be found here :
More information may be found here:: More information may be found here:
It is running on tools.wmflabs.org, and: It is running on tools.wmflabs.org, and is subject to the Wikimedia Cloud Services Terms of use.
ISA is published under GPLv3. Content ad: ISA is published under GPLv3. Content added through the tool to Wikimedia Commons is released under CC0.
Easily Add Information about Images on W: Ajoutez facilement des informations sur les images sur Wikimedia Commons
<strong>ISA</strong> is a multilingual,: ISA est un outil de microcontribution, multilingue et orienté mobile, qui permet d’ajouter, supprimer ou modifier les informations structurées d’images téléversées sur Wikimedia Commons.
<strong>Click on Explore Campaigns to be: Cliquez sur Explorer les campagnes pour commencer
Go to the campaign directory to choose a: Cliquez pour voir la liste complète des campagnes
In the long run, the intent behind the t: Pour célébrer 5 ans d’existence de Wiki Loves Africa, nous avons imaginé ISA afin de faciliter et stimuler l’ajout d’informations descriptives aux images téléversées dans le cadre du concours photo dédié au continent africain.
The tool is aimed to assist in the usefu: Créé pour pouvoir rapidemment ajouter des informations structurées à une collection d’images prédéfinies,
It is initially being built to assist in: ISA est particulièrement adapté pour être utilisé dans le cadre de toutes les compétitions Wiki Loves, mais peut être utilisé de façon générale sur toute collection d’images. L’objectif est d’augmenter l’utilité de ces photos sur les projets Wikimedia et au delà.
The tool is also designed to be a host o: ISA est un outil pilote du projet Données Structurées sur Wikimedia Commons.
ISA is not only an acronym for Informati: ISA n'est pas seulement un acronyme pour Information Structured Acceleration, mais est également un mot chiShona pour «mettre» ou «placer»
Change your available caption languages: Changer les langues de légende disponibles
was developed as a collaboration between: est une collaboration entre Wiki In Africa, Histropedia et le projet Données Structurées sur Commons
and is subject to the: et est soumis aux conditions d’utilisation des
